name: The Ricky Gervais Guide to: The Human Body

transcript.content: As Aldous Huxley once said, man is an intelligence in servitude to his organs made from the same stuff as algae, the human body has evolved into the most complex organism in the universe. An animal with power of introspection, conceiving complex metaphysical notions of morality, beauty and love. While at the same time, battling time, illness and even death with even more sophisticated scientific weaponry. While we may still marvel at its complexity, what do we know about the human body? What are its wonders and limitations? And with scientific and medical technology moving ever forward, how will the human body evolve over the centuries to come? To discuss these questions and more, I'm joined by Stephen Merchant award-winning writer and graduate of the University of Warwick.
Hello
And Karl Pilkington. A man without formal academic qualifications or any awards to speak of, but he's good at other things. Cleaning windows, for example. With his fucking tongue gump!
Ricky & Steve laugh
Bit harsh innit?
Alright

All your cells die and are replaced many times over in your life. Except the brain cells. You only lose them. You lose hundreds and millions and trillions, right? And you've still got plenty left, don't worry. Well most people have.
So only a small percentage of the cells you're born with remain yours, the brain cells. So suppose in your 99% different. All the time. You're changing. Is that the same person?
Well you would say yeah, because you've got the important ones, the brain cells, which keeps your memory, your personality, your input, the you.
But as we talked before, if you took your brain and put it in someone else, would you have the same person? What defines the person?
That's the brain, innit?

It is the brain. But then, if you look different, you'd be treated differently and you have a different personality, you can still be the same person, but people change anyway. People's personalities change. And if you're in a car accident, and you lose all your memories, you've got the same hardware. People have had complete personality changes.

I knew someone who knew someone who's yeah, girlfriend was in a terrible accident, and she lost a lot of her memory and so the person she was with her boyfriend or fianc√©, she no longer related to them in the same way and equally he, obviously that wasn't the same woman they've fallen in love with.
But was it his fault?
It wasn't his fault, no
What that has got to do with it?
No, was it his fault was the accident?
What's that got to do with it?
Because you would be fed up wouldn't you?
That's a completely different point that he was making.
No it wasn't. He said that a woman had an accident.
Yeah, but we were talking about are you the same person...
Hang on, let's hear what Karl's point is
You said, you know, this woman is an accident. It's terrible that, sad.
Yeah.
Now, all I'm saying is
Little bit of opinion just popped in there. "Terrible that. Sad"
She went off him
I'll pass on your condolences
Yeah
She went off the fella
Yeah.

All I'm saying is, you're saying because a brain had a knock and went "Oh, I'm not into him anymore" but all I'm saying is, if it was his fault who was driving the car and it happened because of him, you would sort of go "you idiot".
Yeah, but that's not the point I was making at all.
It's not, is it?
A) He wasn't wasn't involved. but B)

Because she got a form of Amnesia. So she didn't relate to him in the same way, because the life they'd spent together and she no longer had a memory of, an equally when he was talking to her, she was no longer the person that he'd first met. Do you see what I mean? So that's what my point was. Not because he was...
Yeah I know, I can understand that. That doesn't surprise me that much I suppose. At the end of the day is what you go through init.
Yeah
You can harp back and talk about stuff.
Harp back. You can harp back.
Is that what a good relationship is based on? If there's a lot of young people out there listening, they're wondering what to look for.

I think that's the best thing about getting old innit? You can sit down and do nothing but think about a lot. If you are a baby, you've done now. You're lying there, you can't walk. I can't remember being a baby and I put that down to it being boring.
Steve & Ricky both laugh
Karl, you can't remember your birthday!
No it's, you remember the good things in life, don't you? I'm quite happy. I can sit down for a good hour or so, and just think back and go: "Oh, that was good."
When was the last time you reminisced?
Well, my mom that have been around haven't they, so we reminisced a lot.
What were you thinking about?
We're just chatting about Tic Tacs.
(laughing) One of the great memories yeah, the happy memories.
No, because I- Here's the thing. You're saying all that woman changed when she died her head caved in?
He never said that.
What did you- Well, the brain accident.
Yeah. Brain accident, yeah.
The Tic Tacs. Now, I used to love them.
Yeah.
When I was younger.
Yeah
Me Dad got a load of them
What, this year? Just recently?
No no no, years ago.
When I loved them, I said I love Tic Tacs, me. He had one of his mates
You didn't nick them from the sweets shop?
No, he used to have some mate who could get his hands on a load and he must have got about 30 crates of Tic Tacs
30 crates of Tic Tacs?!
Honestly. We'd had... about 24 on each crate.
We got them stuck in a cupboard under the just in the kitchen, in the corner.
Yeah.
Now I work my way through about six crates, quite happy.
When? In how long?
I don't know, about two weeks, three weeks or something.
Right.
And then after that I'm getting sick of these
Right
Yeah. You're minty fresh
You have a lovely fresh breath.
Yeah. But I mean I don't got that much more to tell you about it.
Sorry, wowowowowo. Bear in mind, this when he was recently reminiscing with his parents about. They were sat round and we've already learned up to what hour could go by reminiscing.
I already ran out of responses, I've got nothing to say about that.
No opinion of that
I mean I was nearly gonna say "What do you do about the empty little flicky Tic Tac boxes?"
But you realized that's utterly dull and boring an not of any interest.

Well I was struggling. I don't know what this anecdote is other than a bloke... Other than you said "I like Tic Tacs me." He went: "All right, I'll talk to Albert" "Albert, you got Tic Tacs?" "I've got 30 crates if that'll do?" "Yeah yeah, bring them around." "Come under the cupboard" "He's got through 12 crates!" "What's his breath like?" "Fucking lovely, but he's being sick all over the cunting place!" "Oh do you want some more?" "No! Course we fucking don't!" "You'll talk about that in a few years time" "Course we will, for about a fuckin' hour" "Now we're bringing it up in an audio book"
But that's I think that's how we got onto it because
Because even though I tried to get rid of a load, I used to give him to mates, take them to school. I have some Tic Tacs you can have them for free. We used a load in the cat litter tray.
No. No you didn't.
Yeah, we did. We did. It was just ways of getting rid of them.
Jesus Christ!
Sort of freshy... freshy smell innit? That's the same sort of condensity and that, innit?
Condensity, it is the same condensity.
Similar condensity.
Yeah, so got rid of them like that. And then the weird thing was, even though I got shot of them all, you'd be vaccing up, and you would always hear one ting its way up the tube.
(laughing and singing) It's tinging it's way up the tube. It's stinging its way up the tube
Ricky & Steve singing
It's tinging this way of the tube
Ting-Tong, Ping-pong it's tinging it's way up the tube
That sounds like somthing from Willy Wonka.

No, I'm just I'm just demonstrating that because that's how many of them there were around the house. You'd drop them, they'd go in every corner and that, like Pac-Man or sommet. They'd be everywhere tinging up.
That's amazing
"Sheila's getting married, huh? I'll get the confetti. Don't buy any confetti, go to the cupboard under the stairs."
So yeah, that's a little memory there innit?
It is a little memory
A really little memory.
The strange Tic Tac house in Salford, where everything is made of Tic Tac
Wow, that must have been a hell of a hell of a time with your parents there, the old Tic Tac reminiscence.
No but it's better. You say oh what a boring story that is, but when me Mam and Dad...
"I see you re-graveled, the drive? Yes, pellet" "Suck the drive if you want!"
No, but it's different. When my mom and dad are there, they can remember that and they're going "Oh yeah yeah, the Tic Tac incident
What's known as the Tic Tac Incident
Let us never speak of the Tic Tac Incident!
I just imagine the clock ticking there, it's Christmas Day, you go: "What are you smiling at?" "Ah, remember they used to ting up the tube"
(laughing) Fuckin' hell!
You should think about selling this Hollywood.
Listen, what do you remember then?
What do I remember?!
That's an amazing thing to say!
Wow, that's a difficult question to answer
Yeah I know. Nothing. Nothing at all.

Why- out of interest though - and this is, this will sound naive - why don't we remember the very early moments of our lives? Why is it? Is it is it because it would be too harrowing to remember the point at which sort of born? Because I don't really remember anything from those first few years. Why is it? Is it just because the brain's not fully formed at that moment?
I don't know
The memory is not sufficiently developed?
It's got to be trauma innit? It's the things... Again, we were talking about me being younger, and the youngest I can remember back to was 1978.
How old were you then?
Karl thinks long and hard
When were you born?
What, you couldn't remember earlier than 6?!
You can remember back to about 2 or 3 most people
No, no way! No way!
Me Mam and Dad don't even remember me then.
Ricky & Steve burst out laughing
Because you're not doing anything! This is what I'm saying.
"Me Mam and Dad don't even remember me then!"
That's an amazing...
Because they pinpoint things...
They remember all the Tic Tacs they ever...
"D'ya remember when Karl was 6?" "Of course I do!" "5?" "Yeah" "4?" "Ehh, yeah.." "3?" "No" "2?" "NO!"
Because you're not doing anything, are you?
"Me mam and Dad don't even remember me then!"
So... and it's weird
I remember, must have been about 2, sitting on a potty surrounded by Lego. I remember that very strong image I have of that.
No I don't remember that.
No, you wouldn't remember now, would you, you weren't there.
What do you mean? You don't remember Steve sitting on a potty surrounded by Lego?
No, I mean I can't remember having a potty. I remember...
(shouting) I'm not suggesting you have the same memory!
No you used to go to a fucking cat litter tray, now I know why do you eat a Tic Tac while having a shit!
But ok, so what is your very first memory?
The one that cropped up the other day was having my eyes sort of glue together by...
Steve & Ricky giggle
Gangsters? Where's the fucking Tic Tacs? We lost all a whole truck for you.

No, when I was on holiday and slept near the window and the window was open, I used to wake up in the morning with the me eyes shut. Me Mam and Dad thought I was having a lovely lie-in. I just couldn't open me eyes.
(laughing) I'm gonna burst! What d'ya mean?
What do you mean they were glued?
But why didn't you say, "Mom, Dad. I'm not asleep. My eyes are glued together.
You just get buildup on the eyelashes.
Yeah. But when they came in, and you can sense them looking you
I didn't know they were there!
Ricky bursts laughing
But what do you mean? Why didn't you say something? So you lay there dead still?
Well, you should have sprinkled some Tic Tacs around the bed and you would have heard them crunching in they came in
Yeah. What do you mean? So your eyes are stuck together. You're lying there, you're still you're awake but you can't open your eyes. So you don't say anything.
Yeah
But why?
But every day?
It happened a lot
But your memory was that this was scary to you because you thought you've gone blind.
Probably and it hasn't happened since so it's something you remember happening. It's like the kidney stone thing that will always stay with me because it's like, I was in agony.
Yeah.
And that's what I'm saying about trauma. It's quite frightening when you're a kid and can't open your eyes.
But we don't remember trauma.
Oh right
Steve laughs
Do you remember that conversation we had a few minutes ago
Maybe it's because I had time to lie there and think about it, because I sort of wonder that if having vision does get in the way.
Mmmmm, that's good one. Okay. Go on, interesting
Your eyes are... you know...
Go on. What are they?
Yhey're the thing that makes you do the things you want to do aren't they?
What do you mean? Interesting, go on.
Everything, everything. You might like drawing. Your eyes...
That's an example though beacuse you might liek music and you don't need your eyes for that do you?
Ehm, yeah because you still got to find your way to the record shop to find the record you want.
No, someone could put it for you...
What I mean is, your eyes...
Stevie Wonder
Say rather than...
(mumbles) You might like smells, you might... Wine tasting...
Let me think... I've just always thought...
Blind people...
Go on.
Right, yeah, ok
That makes sense?
Yes
Which means that they'll be more brainy.
Possibly
They won't waste their eyes on watching rubbish telly.
No.
Yep, sure.
But bear in mind, you learn a lot. Don't ya? Just what you see you absorb a lot of information from what you see
Yeah but blind people are going to say, right I'm not going to be defeated here. I'm going to make sure that I still feed me brain with stuff
Right
Whereas, if you've got eyes, your eyes can sometimes say, well, don't listen to that intelligent thing there, watch them rubbish on the telly.
Yeah. Your eyes are saying that are they? Who are they talking to?
I'm just saying if you got eyes...
Yeah, they're talking to you
...they're more drawn(d) to things that...
"Drawnd?" What are you "drawnd" to though?
Keep your eyes... Keep your eyes interested. It's like everything. It picks your food for you.
Mmm.
Does it?
No it doesn't
It does! It does! Of course it does. That's why they advertise food in a way that... those are adverts on the telly: "Look at this, this isn't an ordinary pasta."
Yeah. So you'd eat a nice plastic apple, would you? It'd looked like a lovely... It'd look like an apple. Eat it.
Presentation is 90% of what goes on though in this world.
Mmm.
Whether it's clothes
Is that a statistic that you picked up somewhere?

That's because you know what the thing you like looks like. So you recognize it, you go: "Oh, I like that." You don't go: "Oh I like the look of that, I ate it last time and I liked the look of it as I was eating it." You go: "I know what that is. That's the thing that tasted good."
Not always
No?
I think there's a lot of cakes out there, and I've been conned. Where my eyes have gone: "That looks good." I'll go: "Can I have one of them?" And they get it and it's just like air with cream on it.
But that's you...
Are you furious with your eyes at that point?
Well it's a bit annoying
But you just contradicted your own point.
No I haven't. I've said me eyes have said this is what you want.
Yeah.
And I've been disappointed with it.
So your eyes shouldn't pick your food then, should they really.
They shouldn't, but they do.
Again, the next time give your eyes a go again?
Yeah, I'll say, I'll sort of go: "Hang on a minute! You remember last time!" "This is different!"
You are the strangest man I've ever met.
It's not weird, there's nothing weird about that.
You are the strangest person I've ever met.
So you don't trust anything you see now, you query it, you question...
Here's a clearer way of describing it.
Go on
Holiday brochure. Your eyes look at it. "Look at this villa here. Look at that, it's en peu close to the amenities
Steve & Ricky giggle
Get there, me eyes go: "What have you picked?!" Because it's not as good
WHAT?! Who's arguing now?! Who's angry at your eyes?
Were your eyes angry then?
No, I was angry
Ok so your mouth and brain are angry at your eyes?
Because one, me nose has kicked in. I'm next to the bins.
Right, okay.
You couldn't see that in the brochure.
No. That's true. True, true.
The bottle banks again, they're close by. Me ears are going: "What's the racket?"
Yeah
Me eyes are going: "Sorry!"
What?! Your eyes are saying sorry?!
I'm just saying, you can't trust your eyes.
I always thought they are pretty arrogant, the eyes. I didn't think they care. I'm surprised they feel guilt.
I love the fact that his sense of human biology is based on the Numskulls.
Of course, yeah.
I don't know why you must pick stuff based on what your eyes...
Thought initially...
Well, it depends!
But Karl, they're not detached in this stuff anyway. They're not different operatives all with different agendas, this is all connected.
They should be,

If I look at a picture in a brochure, a magazine and I think "oh, that looks nice." My brain instantly says "Be careful, though. Because as a publicity tool in order to try and sell me this particular ideal, it's prop. Chances are doesn't look exactly than real life, like it does in the brochure." I'm instantly thinking that, I'm not going "Hurray! I'll book that" and then two weeks later I get there I can't believe I'm fucking is employed. Ears what do you make of it? "I'm livid because I can hear some fucking racket!"
All I'm saying is you don't see that many disappointed blind people.
You don't see that many disappointed blind people.
They're not let down that much. They're not let down.
Spurious. That's no... You've got no information for that. No evidence for that at all. You just made that up.
You don't see many disappointed blind people.
I've always been fascinated in biology in general and I remember when I was about 13 or 14, I got this book "Man's body, an owner's manual", I was fascinated by it.
It's like a sort of textbook. Is it about...

It's great because it's got absolutely everything from, you know, life and death. And then I was worried that you could chart, when you die from sort of things like, you know, where you were born, socio-economic group, have you had fillings and I'll go.. Oh, I'd worry. And you

Have point system but it's a fascinating book. It's got everything and of course all the stuff about male sex organs, you know, I can't think of the number of men that went home and got a ruler after reading about averages.
Heh, Yeah.
And there's a nice little chapter here...
What is the average?
You have to push really hard with a ruler until it's sort of like going right into your stomach and then you can get it up to like two or three inches.

Lovely chapter here on sexuality. I want to read one, and this is under the homosexual activities, it goes into what they like: anal sex explains what that is. It's, anal sex. This is inserting the penis into the partners anus, normally with the aid of an artificial lubricant. So it gives you all the details there. Now, in addition to anal intercourse, many homosexuals have practiced fisting, inserting a hand or fist or other objects into
The anus as a form of sexual stimulation. Experience has shown however, that this practice should be avoided since it can cause gay bowel syndrome. Now, I'd never heard of that.
Wow. Gay bowel syndrome?

Yeah, gay bowel syndrome. Fissures, lesions stuff, and other damage to the walls of the rectum. So when you go to the doctor and go "ooh, I've got problems", He'll go "Well you've got gay bowel syndrome. Are you gay?", "Yes, I am. Yeah.", "All right. Well, if you have you been ever, been sticking

Another man's fist up your anus?" "yeah. Yeah, we, uh, we like that." "Okay. Well, my advice to you is to stop that because it's causing damage." "I'll thank you doctor." "I'm not going to stop it by the way, I'm not gonna stop. I'm gonna carry on doing that and then just keep coming back here with a sore arse. If that's, that's all right. And you can just fix it, can you? Because I'm going to... In fact Im going to go home now and do it. Even though you've told me that I probably shouldn't. I'm going to... Gay bowel syndrome you say?"
What d'you, what do you think about that? Sticking a, a, a fist up your arse?
Uh. Weren't meant to be, was it? I mean it's, it's not - you know. It's gonna do damage, innit? It's... it's like... you've gotta know when to stop putting stuff in a carrier bag.
Ricky laughs
And it's the same as that. Innit? 'Cause it rips.
Yeah.
Someone told me this recently at a party. A fascinating fact. Um, see what you think of it, Karl. He told me that apparently if you've got time on your hands you can put your
Fist inside someone else's arse. And then you can work your hand, very slowly, up through the person's body. Takes about two hours, apparently. And eventually-
Ricky laughs
It's what he told me. You can touch that person's heart.
Right.
Right. And it's like the most intimate thing you could ever do with someone else.
Right. That's bollocks.
That's what he said. That's what that bloke said.

How could you touch their heart? One, the alimentary canal is about thirty foot long. So you'd have - either have to have thirty - you'd have to be Mr Tickle, right - or you'd have to be rolling up the alimentary canal as you go, like a
Like a stocking on a pole, right.
Steve laughs

And then when you get up there, how can you touch the heart? You'd have to rip through the oesophagus which would kill them. Okay. If the, if the arm going all the way up their alimentary canal the wrong way didn't kill them.
But I like the idea of someone saying that to a loved one.
Ricky laughs
"Alright, love. Love, little surprise for you. Um. The kids are at your mother's."
Yeah.
"Um, I've, I've put the - the phone's off the hook."
"They're out for two hours."
Yeah!
"They're out for two hours."
They, actually they'd better be out for four, because I'm going to need to get it back out again.
Yeah. "Where's the marge?"
Steve laughs
Imagine the, the doorbell goes, you gotta sign for a package.
Who told you that at a party? A psychopath?
I don't know! You see, he's, he, and then he was convinced it was true because he, he went online to try and, uh, even though were at a party, he found a computer-
Also-
-and started typing in "fist, heart, stuff" and I said, you better delete that-
Yeah.
In case the person whose computer it is finds out.
I know! Fist, heart.
Fist, heart.
Yeah. Also, if the aim is to touch the heart, right? Go via the mouth, it's shorter.
Steve laughs
Let's pop it down the mouth. Yeah. Karl, thoughts?
I mean, there's getting to know people...
Ricky and Steve laugh
I mean, you know how people say, oh, you shouldn't use a toilet with the door open, and all that, because it ruins...
What, the mystqique?
Like, knowing too much everything. But that, for me... Where do you go from there?
Ricky and Steve laugh
Yeah.
Ricky makes a strange little noise
But I've - you know me. I mean I've got nothing against, uh, gays and that-
No.
-but I've - they puzzle me to this day. There's still things that happen when, uh, I go, "What is all that about?"
Like what?
I went to what's-her-name... Harley Street. I went for a, a check-up.
Mm.
And uh, like a medical.
Ah.
Posh, you know Harley Street.
Yeah.

It's like it's the top doctors innit. I've never been before.All posh buildings and that. Uh, went up to the counter and said, uh, "Here to see the doctor." They said name, yep, yeah. It was ten minutes. Go and wait in the waiting room. Dead posh waiting room. Dead fancy. Big leather furniture and that.
Yeah.
Loads of magazines. I mean, like a, like a newsagents. In the middle of the room on a table, loads of them.
I'm looking though and there's, you know, there's the top-quality ones, your Esquire, you know, GQ - classy. Yacht Weekly, err all that. Country Life. Boyz!
Boys???
There's one there. Yeah. Boys. Thought "what's that?", right, lifted up like the one on top of it, and it's like, Boys with a "Z", two fellas' stood there.
(Ricky is trying not to laugh in the background)
Looking sort of Italian looking
Uh-huh, yeah.
Right.
Uhh, remember Brother Beyond? That sort of look.
Right.
Yeah.
Sort of greasy hair [inaudible]
That's a cracking reference there.
Dungarees on.
No shirt though.
No shirt, just dungarees sort of unbuttoned hanging down a little bit.
Sure.
So no one else is about. I'm never going to buy a magazine like that...
Ricky screeches.
I can't believe! You're going to tell us you looked though a gay magazine.
I had a little, little look, just because I thought, you know, like I say - there's one chance.
You're always looking to learn, aren't you? Always looking to learn.
Yeah.
Always open, you know, there might have been something that I go "right I get it now", I understand why they like doing that or whatever.
Yeah.
Right.
So she said I was going to, you know, ten-minute wait I can have a quick flick through.
Picked it up at a look.
Still none-the-wiser.
Why?
Well, what did you say when you open it up?
Just loads of, I mean like I've said to you before about I don't know why, they like looking at knobs when they've got one of their own.
Ricky laughs.
Right.
There's no surprises there you're not going to go "oh right, yeah [trails off]"
Sure.
Yep.
Lots of that.
Yeah but they can't get to it, can they? They can't get to their own.
Who cant?
What if they wanted a little... little chew, little nosh - they can't get to their own, can they, they'd break their back?

But they can't get to this fella's in the magazine. It's only a picture, just looking at it. They might as well look at their own. That's what I mean. Yeah, just have a look at it. They were just stood there. They're not up to anything, they were just sort of stood there. So had, like, car oil on the face. There was one sat on a...
Why?
Dunno, just like a mechanic type thing. Car oil on the face and like rubbed on the chest and that.
Sure.
Knob out...
Yeah.
There was someone sat on one of those square things have hay.
Oh yeah, a bale.
Sat there like sort of sat on it, straddling it.
Yeah. That must have been uncomfortable.
Again, knob out.
Yeah. Yeah. Just looking, just looking like it's normal.
That's great. No farmer walks around that that.
What was the other one, there was uhh, you know motorbike - they the always like them.
Yeah.
Now I'm going through and then, like, the content is all puns...
Right....
It's all, you know, it's a couple of weeks ago should have wrote some down. It all, everything was to do with knob.
Right.
That's the only bit they're interested in, in the male body.
Look at this bloke straddling this huge, throbbing thing. The bikes not bad either.
Yeah, all that, loads of them. It was just, just all just just cock, just 100%. Like, let's just talk about the knob.
That's a good name for a gay magazine.
100% Cock?
100% Cock?
Did it not any moment, sort of, maybe slightly unnerve you might... the doctor might come in and see you reading Boyz?
No, because I wasn't...
Or what if I walked in?

Because I remember once when you were in hospital about to have a tube going down your knob, and you were sitting in your pants with stockings on, and I walk through and you were horrified. So what if I have walked in then and went: "Karl, what are you doing?"
Yeah, and I would have said, "look at this. Look at this, and it's free."
Yeah, and I would have said, "why did you bring that with you?"
No, I would have just said, does it look like I brought it with me?
Yeah, yeah it does, cause I have never, you would NEVER see a gay magazine in a doctor's waiting room! So I think you bought that, and pretended that you found it here.
That's the thing. I was amazed by that.
Because there was no like, you know, Mayfair or anything. They just catered for like, if you wanted a bit of knob action.
Ricky laughs
It was really... Really I could have complained.
Sure
If you gonna have a bit of this, where's the bit of the other?
Yeah (laughs) "If there's a bit of this, where's the bit of the other?"
Another one of the things that they had, and I thought they are really struggling with ideas: They had a 'Suckocko'
Ricky giggles
As is Soduko?
Yeah. Suckocko
Surely Sir Dicko is better
No but it was like Suck cocko.
Yeah but it's dick as well.
Suck Dicko
What, so it was still a Sudoku style puzzle
Yeah yeah yeah
So it was just Soduko but called Suckocko?

Right well, we-well, so let's forget chimp then.
My dad said over Christmas that Who do you Think You Are was on. He said, "oh, why don't you do that?", I said "because it's locking up dead people". There's cousins who I don't even talk to.
Yep. True.
I've no idea...
It annoys me when they cry about their great, great grandmother -
Who they didn't even know.
- yeah I know yeah.
Didn't even know 'em. Don't even know 'em. And all its going to do is dig up problems, isn't it?
Yep
You're going to find someone out who did something wrong and you're going to get the blame for it. I don't want to know. If my cousin was Einstein - Very nice.
Yeah.
But at the end of the day that's going to add extra pressure.
If your brother was Einstein then you really are an underachiever.
Steve laughs.
Do you know what, if he was, I'd know about it.
I don't reckon you would know about it.
I recon I would.
I don't recon your family would be that impressed with Einstein.
They wouldn't have just stayed in touch wouldn't they.
He was always the weird one with the scruffy hair and his tongue out.
Yeah.
No. I reckon the stuff we know is enough now, and all we tend to do is find problems.
All the mystery still in the world-
What a prick...
-the mind-body problem.
What a prick...
How to save the world.
Yeah but we're not are we? We know it's dying - we don't know how to fix it.
Not yet we don't
"Turn your lights off"
But then we did-
You turn yours off. Just get sick of it. Leaflets through the door all the time. Turn your heating off, turn the lights off. Living like a mole.
Ricky laughs.

(laughing) I love his little internal dialogs out loud. They're fantastic. They little discussions he has with himself. Ahh, I can't wait 'till he's old. That's going to be amazing. When we're about 75 and he's- he's fucking moaning. When we're in a little home together. I just- fucking hell. "Ohh Karl do you remember when you were 73?" - "No do I fuck".
"Tell us the tic-tac anecdote again."
Ricky laughs.
Ahh, what a fucking useless buch on cunts.

Well, that's about it for the Ricky Gervais Guide to the Human Body. Hope you enjoyed it. Hope you learnt something. I Know Karl didn't, erm next one, the final one in this series is The Ricky Gervais Guide to the Earth.
Karl, are we gonna do any more guides or...?
I think it's that we've covered the main stuff you need to know.
Yeah. It was good doing the guides though.
I liked it.
I like the attempt of learning.

I remember our early ambition was to actually be educational as well as hopefully entertaining, and I feel perhaps at times we've perhaps slightly shortchanged listeners in terms of what they're learning.
Well they're not learning anything because also, even as you know, compared to karl, we are educated.
Hmm
But we're guessing a lot of the stuff and he flummoxes us, but you know, sometimes - I mean it was fun trying to be pompous and professorial enough just to just to fight Karl's ignorance.
I think we've learned more new words from Karl than we've learned anything else.
Yeah
There's been a lot of the made up words and perhaps more than ever before.
Hmm.
And also some of the most abstract conversations I think we've ever had. I mean, Karl - as he gets older it becomes more arrogant and confident.
He said a new one to me the other day. There was a problem, downloading one of the guides our iTunes and he said "they've added to the fuckaridge"
Steve laughs.
...which is good.
Yeah
So till the next time it's goodbye for me Ricky Gervais. Stephen Merchant...
Goodbye
And Karl Pilkington.
Alright.

synopsis.description: Karl investigates a copy of "Boyz" magazine in a doctors waiting room.
Are we really all related? Karl is skeptical.
Karl won't be living like a mole.
Ricky can't wait for karl to get old.

trivia.description: Boyz is a free, London-based magazine targeted at gay men and the LGBT community. It is distributed mainly through gay bars, pubs, clubs shops and saunas in the United Kingdom.
Brother Beyond were a British pop band who had success in the pop rock genre in the late 1980s. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brother_Beyond
[Who do you think you are](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Who_Do_You_Think_You_Are%3F_(British_TV_series)) is a British TV series where celebrities trace their family history.
